question: In March 2019, the areca nut "Sirsi Supari" has received the Geographic Indication (GI) tag. Which state's geographic speciality is "Sirsi Supari"?
explanation: For the first time in the areca nut sector, ‘Sirsi Supari’ grown in Uttara Kannada, Karnataka has received the Geographic Indication (GI) tag. It is cultivated in Yellapura, Siddapura and Sirsi taluks. Totgars’ Cooperative Sale Society Ltd., Sirsi, is the registered proprietor of the GI.
